ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Has your healthcare provider ever told you that your viral load was not suppressed? (The diagnosis of treatment failure)
If your healthcare provider ever told you that your viral load was not suppressed, have you ever undergone intensive adherence counseling?
How long did you take in this intensive adherence counseling?
How helpful do you think this intensive adherence counseling was?
Notes: 0=Not at all helpful; 1=Not very helpful; 2=Somewhat helpful; 3=Very helpful; 4=Extremely helpful; 666=Missing; 777=NA

ElementDescription: Would you recommend anyone else to go through intensive adherence counseling if they are not doing well on antiretroviral therapy (ART)?
